page.title: 02TRANSPORT
page.content: Alness is on the A9 trunk road,the main road to the north of Scotland.The Inverness_Wick railway line also passes through the town so it is well linked with other areas.There are 4 passengers trains going north and 4 going south everyday except Sunday.On Sunday there is one train in each direction.Alness is well served by the public bus services.Highland Omnibuses run a total of 14 buses each weekday northwards to Tain and the same number south to Inverness.On a Sunday there are only 3 in each direction,with no buses on Sunday morning.The main road,the A9 passes through the centre of the town.This causes congestion at times,especially at the narrow bridge over the River Averon.To ease this congestion a by_pass is planned with work due to start this year (1985).
